updateData.functionBody:
let chartData = functionBodyEval;

return general.createChartConfig(chartData,"line");
return [legendConfigElement];

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;
return [titleConfigElement];

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;
return [lineConfigElement];

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;
return [pointConfigElement];
return [rectConfigElement];

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;
return [xAxisConfigElement];

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;
return [yAxisConfigEntry];

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;
return baseCategoryDataSeriesDataLayout;

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;
return baseNumericDataSeriesDataLayout;

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;

return {   
    type: "radioButtonGroup",
    label: "X Values Type: ",
    entries: [["Category","category"],["Numeric","numeric"]],
    value: "category", //initial default
    horizontal: true,
    key: "xValuesType"
}
return [arcConfigElement];

//If data valid, return true. If data is invalid, return an error message.
return true;

let chartData = functionBodyEval;

return general.createChartConfig(chartData,"bar");

let chartData = functionBodyEval;

return general.createChartConfig(chartData,"scatter");

content.text: Line Graph
Here we develop the forms for the line graph input.
Chart Config
This is the form from the chart layout.
The following table receives the translated output from the lineGraphForm.
Here we must manually paste the "code" from above into the formula for the cell below. This function body should execute to return the config json for the chart.
Below we process the above configuration into the proper input for the chart.
And here is the resulting chart.
General Config
This section has general config options.
Chart Config Generation Settings
This struct gives the information needed to construct the forms for each chart type.
Form Construction
The constructs the chart form layout for a given chart type.
Data Series
The user can enter a number of data series. Each has the following layout.
Numeric Data
Category Data
Series Options
These are the options for the series.
Chart Options
These are the general options for the chart.
AxesConfig
This is the axes config section.
Data Series Data Elements
The following are the elements used in the data series for entering the data. Series options should be appended, whcih will depend on the chart type.
Numeric Data
Category Data
This is the data series input for category data. Category data must be input as a common x category array for all the data series.
Title
The layout configures the title of the chart.
Legend
This layout configures the layout of the chart.
Chart Element Elements
These layouts configure the different elements of the chart. They are used as needed depending on the tyep of chart.
For these, the layouts are typically repeated for the series, so you can customize the series individually or provide common configurations.
Point
Here we are adding an option to show or hide the points.
Line
Rectangle
Arc
Axes
In the future we should add multiple axes for x or y. For now there is just one for each.
X Axis
This entry is only needed when the the data is numeric. There is currently no config for type category.
Here is the form with the element
Y Axis
Currently Y axis is always numeric.
Additional Elements
This element is to enter category data.
The following element is used when we can switch between x data types.
This element is used to pass the x value (using inherit) to child panel elements.
This element should be included in the data series options.
Processing Functions
This function creates a raw chart config from a chart input json, either from the form or from a chart json input.
This function loads the data series where the x values are numeric
This function loads the data series where the x values are categories
This function creates the chartConfig options from the apogee format chart input json.
This function loads the data series options into the target options object from the apogee format input json.

This struct tells gives defaults we want to explicitly set and it shows what field associations we want to make (ie assign hoverBorderWidth the same as borderWidth, if borderWidth is assigned and hoverBorderWidth is not.
For the associations, there is an added field "modifier" which is the string name for a function to modify the source value. Right now the only option is addOne.
These are the list of colors for "auto" color assignment. (We might want to let the users set these globally since the palette will be very important in many cases.)
The following does standard mapping of options from the input json config to create the raw config. In some cases, additional processing may be needed, which will be done externally.
Input Data
The following cells give input data to populate the charts.

Charts Page
This is a page for testing the plain charts.
